body: LGTM
I agree that we should allow EXPLAIN
I can do the change, if you like @mistercrunch.
Go for it!
Sorry for the delay, will review it.
Is this a PyDruid issue around a special type? Any funky datatype here? What's `com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException`?
![](https://www.crossed-flag-pins.com/animated-flag-gif/gifs/Zambia_240-animated-flag-gifs.gif)

I think this specific `msgid` was generated dynamically in the past but does not exist in the source anymore. That's why it shows as commented. Translators shouldn't translate strings that do not exist anymore (commented out).  It's not bad to leave them there in case they were to resurface. 

In case of lines with typo that have been corrected in the source, we could delete them or just leave them there. Fixing them here wouldn't do anything.
Yup @john-bodley  go for it.
@fabianmenges

I'm siding with @john-bodley on this. We need an extra state `exporting` of something like that. [side-mission] could be a great opportunity to add transparency on the bucket's location and/or show export progress.
Pretty sure this has been tackled by now. Closing. Let's reopen with more details if this message comes back up.

LGTM
@williaster @graceguo-supercat

I think this is actually expected. Do you have evidence that it is slower
to load? # requests shouldn't matter if overall load time is faster.
-- 
Chris

Data Visualization
San Francisco

I had to modify the Entrypoint for this to work as advertized

**Original:**
#!/bin/bash
set -ex

if [ "$#" -ne 0 ]; then
    exec "$@"
elif [ "$SUPERSET_ENV" = "local" ]; then
    superset runserver -d
elif [ "$SUPERSET_ENV" = "production" ]; then
    superset runserver -a 0.0.0.0 -w $((2 * $(getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN) + 1))
else
    superset --help
fi

**Change to:**

#!/bin/bash
set -ex

if [ "$SUPERSET_ENV" = "local" ]; then
    superset runserver -d
elif [ "$SUPERSET_ENV" = "production" ]; then
    superset runserver -a 0.0.0.0 -w $((2 * $(getconf _NPROCESSORS_ONLN) + 1))
else
    superset --help
fi

I'm just confused as to what things like `.*addSlice.*` are doing in explore. All the `vendors.*` stuff seems like it shouldn't be required. Many of the bundles that have name pointing to files that shouldn't be required are hundreds of kbs, that can't be good.
![india-country-map](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/35190080/43047254-153538a4-8df2-11e8-9aca-afb1c6e9fde4.png)

@mistercrunch I think these series of PRs are gated by https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5445 which coerces empty strings to NULL (and prevents them from reappearing the in database) given that this PR enforces that the `datasource_source` is non-NULL.

@boorad were you able to make further progress on this? Very keen to see it per #4035 😄

Yeah, I'd guess some type of common dependency between the two, if two or
more files share a dependency it's broken out.

If you're concerned about it we could do more bundle vis analysis or
tweaking of the splitchunks plugin. But I wouldn't say something's wrong
based solely on the name of the files, with an app this complex its hard to
know what to expect the dependency tree to look like.

@xeijin no, I've been busy.  The changes don't seem too hard, but I'm going to have even less time coming up.   :(

I'll see what I can do next week.
@mistercrunch can you please review the changes?
When you say sub-optimal, it seems to me like the difference`''` vs `NULL` wouldn't make much of a difference from a perf standpoint.
LGTM, though it looks like you forked a broken build, `master` is broken atm. You'll have to rebase once it's fixed..
Sure, thanks @mistercrunch

"limitSpec": {"columns": [{"dimension": {"aggregate": "SUM","column": {"column_name": "impressions","description": null,"expression": null,"filterable": false,"groupby": false,"is_dttm": null,"optionName": "_col_impressions","type": "doubleSum","verbose_name": null},"expressionType": "SIMPLE","fromFormData": false,"hasCustomLabel": false,"label": "SUM(impressions)","optionName": "metric_6nkhk39wj0j_ym12qdvuhqa","sqlExpression": null},"direction": "descending"}],"limit": 10000,"type": "default"},

2)- com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonMappingException :-- exception error throwing by druid.
coming when limitSpec JSON specifies an array while you're trying to deserialize into an object.

com.fasterxml.jackson.databind :-- is library , that support  General data-binding functionality for Jackson: works on core streaming API .  https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.fasterxml.jackson.core/jackson-databind

How about using [PyAthena](https://github.com/laughingman7743/PyAthena#sqlalchemy). It is written in python only. So you will not get any java error!

It will work if you install via ``pip install "PyAthena>1.2.0"`` and just replace SQLAlchemy URI ``awsathena+jdbc://`` with ``awsathena+rest://``.

@villebro I'm trying to understand how #5178 handles lowercasing or removes the need for it
I'd recommend adding a note in `UPDATING.md` about taking a database backup prior to this upgrade. I'm guessing it's the only way people could go back to a previous state.
I think you branched while `master` was broken, mind rebasing?

@mistercrunch The lowercasing hack was introduced to deal with SQLA engines that returned different cases for column names in the cursor.description (db api 1) which was used by e.g. SQL Lab and ResultProxy.keys() (db api 2), which was used for retrieving data. #5178 replaced all v2 api calls with v1 calls, ensuring that the column names are always of the same case.

I reproduced locally on the master branch running superset with the following command

```
gunicorn -w 1 -k gevent --timeout 120 -b 0.0.0.0:8088 --limit-request-line 0 --limit-request-field_size 0 superset:app
```

If I load a chart based on a query that takes a long time to run, all the request I try to make while the chart is loading are hanging.

I managed to work around that by configuring the pg driver to run in a non-blocking style in superset_config.py (see http://initd.org/psycopg/docs/advanced.html#support-for-coroutine-libraries).

```
import psycopg2
from psycopg2 import extensions

from gevent.socket import wait_read, wait_write

def make_psycopg_green():
    """Configure Psycopg to be used with gevent in non-blocking way."""
    if not hasattr(extensions, 'set_wait_callback'):
        raise ImportError(
            "support for coroutines not available in this Psycopg version (%s)"
            % psycopg2.__version__)

    extensions.set_wait_callback(gevent_wait_callback)

def gevent_wait_callback(conn, timeout=None):
    """A wait callback useful to allow gevent to work with Psycopg."""
    while 1:
        state = conn.poll()
        if state == extensions.POLL_OK:
            break
        elif state == extensions.POLL_READ:
            wait_read(conn.fileno(), timeout=timeout)
        elif state == extensions.POLL_WRITE:
            wait_write(conn.fileno(), timeout=timeout)
        else:
            raise psycopg2.OperationalError(
                "Bad result from poll: %r" % state)

make_psycopg_green()
```

I still have an issue when loading multiple charts (6+) with long running queries at the same time and I'm not quite sure what's causing the workers to be blocked.

closing this in favor of #5469

no worries about the history preservation, I closed [#4313](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/4313). 

I think we'll still iterate on the styling of this to make sure there's an option to set color based on the compare ratio delta.

@xiaohanyu sorry about that! 🙉
